title: When struggling in ARAM (I know, who cares, "It's ARAM")
body:
I play ARAMs a lot, just for fun, .. and that is all it is to me, fun. 

Unfortunately, there are times where someone gets a bad draw, and they become toxic, troll, complain, feed, afk, dc, ... blah blah blah,

I get it, it sucks to be a melee assassin against a team of marksmen, mages, and tanks. You can't get close enough to the squishies to blow them up, .. so when you go in you get slaughtered. 

What do you do?

Two options, ... well, the previous things I mentioned are also options, but these two are actually helpful to your team. 

One, .. build full tank. .... As a melee champion, you have better defensive stats than ranged champions, and most of the time you will get beefy enough to actually become surprisingly effective despite the lack of damage compared to your normal build. 

Two, ... and this is honestly the most important, ... STAY ALIVE! ... Stay near the back line. Be a freaking bodyguard. Literally BE AN ADDITIONAL BODY! You're still a threat to the enemy team, especially if your other teammates are actually managing to handle their own. 

Just make it through that match and move on to the next one, but don't be a baby, ... please.

Option C: run down lane: as long as you get a kill, inting 4 assists was WORTH!

Well, as I described in the post, .. there are many situations where "running it down" literally just leads to you giving over a kill and assist(s) because most champions have some form of crowd control / peel. 

And doing that multiple times will only lead to you being underleveled, with little gold/items, and leaving your team with a numbers disadvantage. 

Sitting at extreme exp range and dodging poke is actually a better advantage for your team because you will gain levels and your mere presence is a threat to the enemy.
That was blatant sarcasm. I am sorry.
The sad thing is, I am convinced that people actually do believe this is a legitimate strategy.

People incapable of first-grade addition or learning from experience make up most of the population.

Case study: note how almost all ARAM games are just teams taking turns running down lane and getting aced at nexus, until respawn timers get long enough for one team to win. Despite this, nobody _ever_ pauses and considers if they should defend instead of push, in order to be the ones getting the ace. Suggest it, and they call you trash, a feed, and spam ping madly before running down by themselves and dying.

This is very true. I have actually lost so many games because people want to do nothing but chase down retreating enemies way ahead of the minion waves, only to end up getting turned on and killed. 

When the enemy team can't fight win a fight against your team, all you need to do is stand behind your minions as they slowly march into the enemy's nexus. 

Let them make the mistake of trying to fight and it's gg.
